com.google.enterprise.connector.spi
Interface Property

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleProperty
public interface Property

Interface that represents a property. A property is a named list of Values. Similar to DocumentList and Property, list access is based on a "cursor" concept, like that of java.sql.ResultSet. Initially, the cursor is positioned before the first Value. A call to nextValue() both returns a boolean, indicating whether there are any more values, and advances the cursor to point at the next one. A call to getValue() returns the Value currently pointed to by the cursor.

The consumer of this structure:

  • Should never call getValue() before first calling nextValue(). The implementor of this interface may throw an IllegalStateException if that happens.
  • Should never refer to a Property object obtained by getValue() after a subsequent call to nextValue() unless that subsequent call returns false. In other words, a Value object obtained through getValue() becomes invalid as soon as another valid Value is so obtained.
The typical pattern for consuming an object that implements this interface is this (disregarding exception handling): 
 Property prop = ...
 String name = prop.getPropertyName();
 while (prop.nextValue()) {
   Value val = prop.getValue();
   handleValue(val);
 }

Method Detail

getPropertyName

public java.lang.String getPropertyName()
                                 throws RepositoryException
Get the name of the current property.

Returns:
The property name
Throws:
RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs

nextValue

public boolean nextValue()
                  throws RepositoryException
Moves the value cursor down one row from its current position. The value cursor is initially positioned before the first value; the first call to the method nextValue makes the first value the current value; the second call makes the second value the current value, and so on.

Returns:
true if the new current value is valid; false if there are no more values
Throws:
RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs

getValue

public Value getValue()
               throws RepositoryException
Get the current value, as a Value object

Returns:
the current value
Throws:
RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs
